marketNews.title: Dairy Sector 1H25: CMRY Exceeds Expectations, ULTJ Weak
marketNews.content: Cisarua Mountain Dairy ($CMRY) and Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company ($ULTJ) - the two main issuers in the dairy sector - recorded contrasting performance during 1H25. CMRY recorded net profit of Rp 514 billion in 2Q25 (+24% YoY, +7% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 1H25 reaching Rp 994 billion (+24% YoY) and exceeding expectations (59% of 2025F consensus estimate). Meanwhile, ULTJ recorded a net profit of Rp 239 billion in 2Q25 (-32% YoY, -34% QoQ), causing the net profit for 1H25 to decrease by -20% YoY to Rp 604 billion. Here are some key highlights from the performance releases of these two issuers: Dairy Segment Recorded Weak Performance. CMRY's revenue from the 'Dairy Product' segment grew slightly in 2Q25 to Rp 933 billion (+3% YoY, +8% QoQ), although this segment was still corrected by -4% YoY during 1H25 due to weak realization in 1Q25 (-11% YoY, -16% QoQ). Due to the weakening of this business and the strength of the 'Consumer Foods' segment, the contribution of the 'Dairy Product' segment to total revenue in 1H25 fell to 35% (vs. 1H24: 42%). Meanwhile for ULTJ, total revenue decreased in 2Q25 to Rp 1.8 trillion (-16% YoY, -21% QoQ), marking the lowest realization since 3Q21 at Rp 1.7 trillion. This result caused ULTJ's total revenue in 1H25 to fall -8% YoY to Rp 4.1 trillion. At ULTJ itself, the 'Dairy' segment is the largest contributor to the company's revenue, equivalent to 77% as of 9M24. CMRY's Consumer Foods Segment Grew Solidly Amidst the 'soft' 'Dairy Product' segment, CMRY recorded solid total revenue growth in 2Q25 (+21% YoY, +11% QoQ), supported by the 'Consumer Foods' segment revenue growing +33% YoY and +13% QoQ. During 1H25, CMRY's 'Consumer Foods' segment revenue grew +32% YoY. Contrasting Opex Efficiency Levels. Besides revenue growth, CMRY also succeeded in maintaining opex, with a relatively moderate increase during 1H25 (+6% YoY). This caused the operating profit margin to rise during 1H25 to 22.2% (vs. 1H24: 19.8%), resulting in operating profit growing +31% YoY. Meanwhile, ULTJ's operating profit margin during 1H25 decreased to 16.7% (vs. 1H24: 18.9%) due to a rise in opex (+5% YoY) amidst declining revenue. This caused ULTJ's operating profit during 1H25 to fall -19% YoY. Key Takeaway: CMRY Management expects revenue growth of around +10-15% YoY during 2025, with a gross profit margin guidance in the range of 42-44%. With the performance realization during 1H25, we assess that CMRY can meet or even exceed management targets and consensus expectations. CMRY management will hold the 1H25 performance earnings call on Wednesday (30/7) afternoon. Since the release of 2Q25 results on Monday (28/7) afternoon, CMRY's stock price has risen +5.77% to Rp 4,950 per share until Tuesday (29/7).

marketNews.title: Investment Strategy for Small Capital
marketNews.content: "Don't forget profit taking and MAKE THE PROFITS INTO SHARES." - teddyed

tickerNews.title: HRTA 1H25: Net Profit +69% YoY, Exceeds Expectations
tickerNews.content: HRTA: Hartadinata Abadi recorded a net profit of Rp 199 billion in 2Q25 (+93% YoY, +33% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to Rp 349 billion (+69% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equals 62% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. the last 2-year average: 54% annual net profit realization) and equals 58% of management's 2025 net profit target. Net profit growth was supported by revenue growth of +96% YoY/+83% YoY in 2Q25/1H25, with 1H25 revenue equaling 56% of management's 2025 target. Meanwhile, the gross profit margin fell to 4.9% in 2Q25 (vs. 2Q24: 6.2%, 1Q25: 5.1%) and 5% during 1H25 (vs. 1H24: 6.3%).

tickerNews.title: AUTO 1H25: Net Profit Declined Due to One-off Other Income
tickerNews.content: AUTO: Astra Otoparts recorded a net profit of Rp 433 billion in 2Q25 (-20% YoY, -14% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 1H25 reaching Rp 939 billion (-7% YoY) and equaling 45% of the 2025F consensus estimate. The year-on-year decline in net profit - both in 2Q25 and 1H25 - was mainly caused by a drastic decrease in other income, as the company divested assets last year. Operationally, operating profit still grew year-on-year, rising +7%/+10% YoY in 2Q25/1H25, driven by revenue growth (+2%/+4% YoY) and an increase in the operating profit margin.

tickerNews.title: DRMA 1H25: Net Profit Still Grew Slightly Despite Lower Margins
tickerNews.content: DRMA: Dharma Polimetal recorded a net profit of Rp 97 billion in 2Q25 (-6% YoY, -32% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 1H25 reaching Rp 240 billion (+1% YoY) and equaling 40% of the 2025F consensus estimate. The year-on-year decline in net profit was mainly caused by lower margins amidst still growing revenue. Gross profit margins were recorded at 15.2%/16.3% in 2Q25/1H25, compared to 16.5%/17.5% in 2Q24/1H24. Revenue itself increased +8%/+9% YoY in 2Q25/1H25.

tickerNews.title: PTRO 1H25 Net Profit Below Expectations Due to Foreign Exchange Loss
tickerNews.content: PTRO: Petrosea recorded a net profit of US$0.2 million in 2Q25 (-87% YoY, -83% QoQ). This result made the net profit for 1H25 reach US$1.1 million (-19% YoY), below our expectations (8% of Stockbit's 2025F estimate). The weak 2Q25 net profit was pressured by an exchange loss of -US$10.4 million (vs. 1Q25: profit US$7.1 million, 2Q24: profit US$2.3 million). Operationally, EBITDA reached US$46.9 million in 2Q25 (+79% YoY, +94% QoQ), resulting in EBITDA for 1H25 becoming US$71.1 million (+51% YoY) and in line with our expectations (42% of Stockbit's 2025F estimate vs. 3-year average: 43% annual EBITDA realization).

tickerNews.title: CIO Danantara Denies Rumors of Cooperation with Sentul City (BKSL)
tickerNews.content: CIO Danantara, Pandu Sjahrir, stated that he was unaware of any cooperation plan with Sentul City. Pandu's statement emerged after rumors circulated that Danantara would develop a special economic zone (KEK) based on health services on land belonging to BKSL. Although not commenting on the rumor of cooperation on a health KEK with Danantara, BKSL stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company has entered the preliminary study and exploration phase related to cooperation on a PLTS (Solar Power Plant) project, as reported by Bloomberg Technoz.

tickerNews.title: KRYA Acquiring 51% Stake in EV Company, Targets 900k E-Motorbike Replacement in 5 Years
tickerNews.content: Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya (KRYA) announced that the prospective buyer of its shares, Rich Step International Ltd., has completed the due diligence process on July 28, 2025, to proceed with the acquisition. Later, the KRYA shares acquired by Rich Step International will be allocated to Green City SG Pte. Ltd., a Singaporean company owned by Rich Step International, Yang Jie, and Green Power Group (LABA). KRYA stated that Rich Step International plans to consolidate business by executing a 51% participation in an electric vehicle (EV) sector company, which will be announced later. KRYA also mentioned that the company and Rich Step International aim to replace about 900,000 existing motorbike taxis (ojol) in Indonesia with electric motorbikes within the next 5 years, and will venture into three- and four-wheeled electric vehicles in the future. In order to support future business development, KRYA plans to raise funds through either a rights issue or other financing methods.

tickerNews.title: RUIS Subsidiary to Sell 5% Stake in Sorik Marapi Geothermal Power
tickerNews.content: Radiant Utama Interinsco through its subsidiary, PT Supraco Indonesia, plans to divest a 5% ownership stake in PT Sorik Marapi Geothermal Power to OTP Geothermal Pte. Ltd. and KS Orka Renewables Pte. Ltd. In this plan, KS Orka will acquire 1.43% of the shares, while OTP Geothermal will take over 3.57% of the shares. Although the transaction value has not been announced, this corporate action has the potential to be classified as a material transaction because its value exceeds 20% but is still below 50% of the company's equity.

tickerNews.title: Investment Realization 1H25 Reaches Rp 942.9 Trillion, FDI Falls -7% YoY in 2Q25
tickerNews.content: The Ministry of Investment and Downstreaming recorded that Indonesia's investment realization in 2Q25 reached Rp 477.7 trillion (+11.5% YoY, +2.7% QoQ). This result brought the investment realization during 1H25 to Rp 942.9 trillion (+13.6% YoY), equivalent to 49.5% of the 2025 target of Rp 1,905.6 trillion, with employment absorption of approximately 1.26 million people. Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in 2Q25 dropped -7% YoY to Rp 202.2 trillion, marking the largest contraction in the last 5 years. This result caused FDI contribution to total investment realization during 1H25 to only reach 45.9%.

tickerNews.title: US President Trump Plans to Raise Global Basic Tariff to 15-20%
tickerNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, stated on Monday (28/7) that he plans to raise the global basic tariff to the range of 15-20%, higher than the announcement in April 2025 at 10%. Trump's statement came a few days before the August 1, 2025 tariff deadline, while dozens of countries have not yet reached a trade agreement with the US.

tickerNews.title: BI Seeks Room to Lower BI Rate; Government Prepares Third Stimulus Package
tickerNews.content: Bank of Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, stated on Monday (28/7) that the central bank continues to seek room to lower interest rates to support economic growth. Perry mentioned that the timing and magnitude of the future BI Rate decrease will be measured in accordance with global and domestic economic dynamics. On the same occasion, Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani, confirmed that the Financial System Stability Committee (KSKK) will work together to maintain economic growth. The government itself will prepare the third stimulus package this year to support national economic growth around +5% YoY throughout 2025, said Sri Mulyani. This latest stimulus package is expected to boost domestic transportation, tourism, and economic activities in the regions during the year-end holidays.

tickerNews.title: Government to Place APBN Funds in 4 State Banks to Fund Village Cooperatives at 6% Interest Rate
tickerNews.content: Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani, stated on Monday (28/7) that the government will place State Budget funds - including Surplus Budget Balances (SAL) - into the 4 state-owned banks (Himbara), namely Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS). Nevertheless, the amount of this fund placement is still being discussed by the government. The placement of these funds is done by the government to ensure that working capital credit disbursed to over 80,000 Village Cooperatives (Kopdes) Merah Putih will not absorb bank liquidity. Sri Mulyani stated that this allows the four banks to provide loans to Kopdes Merah Putih at a low interest rate of 6%. Kopdes Merah Putih was launched last week, with each cooperative able to apply for loans from Himbara up to Rp 3 billion.

tickerNews.title: Four Indonesian Nickel Smelters Halt Production Due to Oversupply and Low Prices
tickerNews.content: Djoko Widajatno, Mining Advisory Board Member of the Indonesian Nickel Miners Association (APNI), told Kontan on Tuesday (29/7) that at least 4 large smelters in Indonesia partially/totally halted their production lines during 1H25, mainly due to pressure from oversupply and low nickel prices. These smelters include PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry, PT Indonesia Tsingshan Stainless Steel, PT Virtue Dragon Nickel Industry, and PT Huadi Nickel Alloy Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: SMSM Plans Second Interim Dividend for 2025 at Rp 35/Share
tickerNews.content: Selamat Sempurna (SMSM) plans to distribute the second interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to approximately Rp 201.6 billion or Rp 35 per share, indicating a dividend yield of 1.8% as of Tuesday (29/7). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is August 6, 2025, with payment on August 26, 2025. Previously, SMSM distributed an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to Rp 25 per share on May 27, 2025.

tickerNews.title: WIRG Shareholder Sells 537 Million Shares, Ownership Drops to ~13.98%
tickerNews.content: Wir Asia (WIRG) shareholder, PT Laut Biru Teknologi, sold approximately 537 million WIRG shares at an average price of Rp 124 per share on July 24-25, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately Rp 67 billion. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Laut Biru Teknologi in WIRG decreased from 18.48% to ~13.98%.
